column4: hello, i am wondering why the update manager wont let me update three packages, linux header, image and restricted modules. they are greyed out in the update manager
it's on the repo side,  leave it alone they will update when they get fixed or what ever
apply is greyed out after i tell it to create the disklabel
then you proceed and add the new partitons
that is the problem. When i try to right click > new, it says i need to create the disk label again. even though i just told it to create it.
leave gparted, go back in , try again
got a cd with the harware,  see if you have a recovery prog on it
are you saying that i should see if i have a recovery cd that came with my usb hdd?
more or less,   recovery format  maintenence,  stuff in general
basicaly if this were 10 years ago with an internal hdd I would tell you to low format it , but that 's not an option anymore so I don't know what to tell you
i am going to see if my dads mac can format this drive for fat32, see if it that can re-create the disk label.
open a blank instance of mplayer, then go to the preferences ,  and make sure the audio device is  alsa
it is... but isnt the mplayer gui just a frontend to mplayer (cli)....so why is the cli working but not the gui
don'T know , you can probably ask in #mplayer they should know
